pull.title: net: improve nLastBlockTime and nLastTXTime documentation
pull.body:
Follow-up to #19731 to help alleviate confusion around `nLastBlockTime` and `nLastTXTime`, now also provided by the JSON-RPC API as `last_block` and `last_transaction` in `getpeerinfo` output.

Thanks to John Newbery, credited in the commit, and to Dave Harding and Adam Jonas during discussions on how to best explain these in this week's Optech newsletter.

events.message:
net: improve nLastBlockTime and nLastTXTime documentation

Co-authored-by: John Newbery <john@johnnewbery.com>

events.body: ACK d780293e1ee0f9e66bd2d88914694c17f9aaa0ca .  The added documentation matches my reading of the code and answers a question I had after seeing #19731

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #19829 ([net processing] Move block inventory state to net_processing by jnewbery)
* #19670 (Protect localhost and block-relay-only peers from eviction by sdaftuar)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

ACK d780293e1ee0f9e66bd2d88914694c17f9aaa0ca

Great to see Optech collaboration resulting in improved documentation!
